name: Date and Rhubarb Chutney
description: If your dates are chewy and hard, soak them in just-boiled water to cover for about 1 hour, until softened. Then drain and blend. Makes 1 1/3 cups.
recipeIngredient: 3/4 cup coarsely chopped or hand-torn pitted Medjool dates ((about 5 ounces))
1/4 cup lightly packed shaved jaggery, (brown sugar, coconut sugar, or palm sugar (1.7 ounces))
1/2 teaspoon pounded cumin seeds or ground cumin

recipeInstructions.text: Cut the rhubarb into chunks roughly 3/4 inch wide, then put into a blender with 1/2 cup water. Whirl into a raspberry-colored puree. It won’t be totally smooth but do your best to minimize stringiness.
recipeInstructions.name: Cut the rhubarb into chunks roughly 3/4 inch wide, then put into a blender with 1/2 cup water. Whirl into a raspberry-colored puree. It won’t be totally smooth but do your best to minimize stringiness.

recipeInstructions.text: Scrape into a small saucepan and bring to a vigorous simmer over medium heat. Lower the heat to cook (expect some sputtering) for 5 minutes, until thickened with no liquid separating. Remove from the heat and let cool for about 10 minutes. You should net about 3/4 cup.
recipeInstructions.name: Scrape into a small saucepan and bring to a vigorous simmer over medium heat. Lower the heat to cook (expect some sputtering) for 5 minutes, until thickened with no liquid separating. Remove from the heat and let cool for about 10 minutes. You should net about 3/4 cup.

recipeInstructions.text: Meanwhile, rinse the blender..Return the rhubarb to the cleaned blender, then add 1/3 cup water plus the dates, sugar, salt, and cayenne. Blend to a smooth, thick texture. As needed, pause the machine to scrape down the sides. Ideally, the chutney is thick enough to mound on a spoon. (If you want a thinner sauce, add water by the tablespoon but you may need to adjust the other ingredients too.)
recipeInstructions.name: Meanwhile, rinse the blender..Return the rhubarb to the cleaned blender, then add 1/3 cup water plus the dates, sugar, salt, and cayenne. Blend to a smooth, thick texture. As needed, pause the machine to scrape down the sides. Ideally, the chutney is thick enough to mound on a spoon. (If you want a thinner sauce, add water by the tablespoon but you may need to adjust the other ingredients too.)

recipeInstructions.text: Transfer to a bowl (or airtight container) and stir in the cumin. Taste and if it is too sweet, stir in the vinegar. Let sit for about 2 hours to allow flavors to fully develop. Serve, refrigerate for up to 2 weeks; I’m sure this is freezable for a month too!
recipeInstructions.name: Transfer to a bowl (or airtight container) and stir in the cumin. Taste and if it is too sweet, stir in the vinegar. Let sit for about 2 hours to allow flavors to fully develop. Serve, refrigerate for up to 2 weeks; I’m sure this is freezable for a month too!
